alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 07 at 12:59PM MST until March 10 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 15 inches possible. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Ranges to include Centennial and Albany. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Outdoor enthusiasts including snow mobilers and hikers can expect very low visibility in moderate snow and blowing snow. Individuals could easily become disoriented and lost. Dangerous travel conditions possible due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
